thread.title: Wolves come up clutch in overtime to beat Magic | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Wolves come up clutch in overtime to beat Magic | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Wolves come up clutch in overtime to beat Magic | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 12:58am EST January 31, 2017 12:02am EST Minnesota makes if five wins from their past six. NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
Throughout the course of Monday’s game against the Orlando Magic, the Minnesota Timberwolves had multiple players step up in the clutch to lead the Wolves to a 111-105 overtime win at Target Center. 
MORE: Sixers continue good form with narrow win over Sacramento 
With the Wolves trailing the Magic by six midway through the third quarter, Minnesota was in search of a spark to help them claw back into the game. 
“We were low energy to start. In the end, we made mistakes but we still found a way to win, so that was good. That was a positive," Wolves coach Tom Thibodeau said after the game. 
Ricky Rubio answered the call. Rubio scored 13 points and hitting three 3-pointers in the frame to help give the Wolves an 80-79 lead going into the fourth quarter. 
In the fourth, with the Wolves trailing 98-96 with 25 seconds remaining, it was Andrew Wiggins’ turn. Wiggins sunk a jump shot with 10 seconds remaining to tie the game up and force overtime. 
“He hit a huge shot for us. . . I liked his aggressiveness in the fourth," Thibodeau said of Wiggins. "I liked the way he was attacking the basket. The shot he made to tie the game, that’s his shot. He got right is shot, had great balance and knocked it down. Everyone did their job to execute. The screening was good, the pass from Ricky was good. Wig making that shot, it was good shot-making from him.” 
Rubio finished with 22 points, eight rebounds, eight assists and made a career-high six threes, while Wiggins finished with a game-high 27 points and five assists to lead Minnesota. 
Towns added 23 points, 12 rebounds and seven assists, Zach LaVine had 11 points and three rebounds, and Shabazz Muhammad had 10 points and five rebounds. Nemanja Bjelica provided big minutes late, finishing with seven points and four rebounds, while Gorgui Dieng added five points and tied a season-high 14 rebounds in the game. 
Elfrid Payton had 21 points and four rebounds to lead Orlando. C.J. Watson had 18 points and four rebounds, Serge Ibaka had 17 points and 10 rebounds, Nikola Vucevic had 13 points and 11 rebounds, and Aaron Gordon added 12 points and six rebounds. 
Minnesota shot 40-for-92 (43.5 percent) from the field in the game, including going 12-of-29 (41.4 percent) from three. Orlando shot 41-for-96 (42.7 percent) from the field and went 10-for-35 (28.6 percent) from behind the arc. 
The Wolves improve to 19-29 overall with the win and move into a three-way tie for 10th place in the Western Conference. The Magic fall to 19-31 on the season with the loss.
